Answer: Dependability is being counted to produce results with consistency. It also includes doing it the way it was intended and on time. That being said, it includes communicating whether the results will be as intended, on time, or behind schedule, and alternatives to make things work.As a safety, health, & environmental professional; I’ve dealt with multi-million dollar projects and very small ones. question: https://www.quora.com/What-is-dependability-in-the-workplace-and-what-are-some-examples

Answer: Short Answer - Dependability is doing what you said you would do. Directly, this means completing projects, assignments, and tasks on time and on budget. Indirectly this means coming to work every day, attending meetings you are supposed to attend, not making mistakes, and staying out of trouble.
